newsitem.title: SWITZERLAND: Swiss shares end lower after U.S. job data.
newsitem.headline: Swiss shares end lower after U.S. job data.

text.p: 1545 GMT - Swiss shares ended lower, led down by stronger than expected U.S. December jobs data , dealers said.
Until the data, the market had moved sideways.
Dealers said fears of rising interest rates pressured financial shares, while industrial stocks saw profit-taking.
Losses were mainly a consolidation of recent gains.
The SMI index of leading shares ended 18.8 points lower at 3,947.4. The all-share SPI fell 12.58 points to 2,526.61.
Turnover-leader Novartis bearers were one franc lower at 1,539 by close after an earlier high at 1,550.
